newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.03 rupees down at 42.58 to the dollar on Sunday in the kerb amid a rise in dollar demand for the U.S. currency and dealers said the rupee could slip further on Monday.
They said news of unrest in Islamabad prompted investors to go long in dollars. "Political uncertainty usually results in higher dollar buying," one dealer said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed unchanged at 6.30 percent. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
